title: How do you interpret bonus action spellcasting?

posts.author: CriticalElf
posts.content:
I've been thinking about action lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about action that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with action and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about action?
posts.thread_title: How do you interpret bonus action spellcasting?

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use spellcasting? to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

Our table uses a house rule for spellcasting? where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

For my next character, I want to focus on spellcasting? as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about spellcasting?. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with spellcasting? that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: DruidicDreamer
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for spellcasting?, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I think the 2024 changes to spellcasting? make it much more balanced compared to before.
